column4: anybody have any idea why my video in, say, totem-gstreamer might be stretched vertically?
example: http://threadbox.net/broke-gstreamer.png
its probably misreading the video aspect or the video file has incorrect aspect ratio
the video file is fine. I can play them back fine in x11 mode
but the performance is terrible
where is the aspect ratio configured (that ... i guess gstreamer is gonna read from)
what do you mean its fine in x11 mode?
gstreamer-properties ... i was able to configure the gstreamer video driver there
that is just the driver that gstreamer uses to output the video (it shouldn't affect the video ratio)
well it does.
what driver where you having problems with?
Xv. it makes the video nice and smooth.
yes xv is more efficient than the x11 driver - do you get the same problem with other players (e.g. mplayer)
yeah, I get the same issue in miro as it employs gstreamer... mplayer works fine, though
using xv in mplayer?
!ask
yeah, actually... it is the xv driver that is working fine for mplayer
then its probably a problem with the way gstreamer is talking to the xv driver - if you want to use the xv driver with totem you could try totem-xine
yeah, xine is an option... i'd sorta rather just figure out what's wrong with gstreamer tho
we'll try at this a little longer ;) thanks anyway
maybe try the gstreamer channel (/join #gstreamer)
i asked there first :)
